column2: Ah, that is very lovely, cried the Elves, gathering round little Sunbeam as she ceased, to place a garland in her hair and praise her song.
column3: Ah, that is very lovely, cried the Elves, gathering round little Sunbeam as she ceased, to place a garland in her hair and praise her song.

column2: Now, said the Queen, "call hither Moon-light and Summer-Wind, for they have seen many pleasant things in their long wanderings, and will gladly tell us them."
column3: Now, said the Queen, "call hither Moon light and Summer Wind, for they have seen many pleasant things in their long wanderings, and will gladly tell us them."

column2: Most joyfully will we do our best, dear Queen, said the Elves, as they folded their wings beside her.
column3: Most joyfully will we do our best, dear Queen, said the Elves, as they folded their wings beside her.
